Detailed Description

Functions to capture eye diagram and print the diagram.

$Id$

static uint32_t cvmx_eye_measure_errors ( int  node,
int  qlm,
int  lane,
int  x,
int  y 
) [static]

Move the eye sample location and measure the errors at that location.

See eye_move_location() for more detail about the moving of the sample location as this function wraps eye_move_location().

Parameters:
node Node to access
qlm QLM to access
lane Lane to access
x Location along the X axis (time) (0-127, or 128)
y Location along Y axis (-31,31)
Returns:
Number of errors
static void cvmx_eye_move_location ( int  node,
int  qlm,
int  lane,
int  x,
int  y 
) [static]

Move the eye sample location.

The hardware may lose lock if we move the shadow sampler in large steps. This code reads the current location and moves the sampler one step at a time. Note that if told to move to 128 (MAX_X), we will move up to 127 and then jump to 0, causing a rotation.

Parameters:
node Node to access
qlm QLM to access
lane Lane to access
x Location along the X axis (time) (0-127, or 128)
y Location along Y axis (-31,31)

int cvmx_qlm_eye_display ( int  node,
int  qlm,
int  qlm_lane,
int  format,
const cvmx_qlm_eye_t *  eye 
)

Display an eye diagram for the given QLM lane.

The eye data can be in "eye", or captured during the call if "eye" is NULL.

Parameters:
node Node to use in numa setup
qlm QLM to use
qlm_lane Which lane
format Display format. 0 = raw, 1 = Color ASCII
eye Eye data to display, or NULL if the data should be captured.
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
